slides.title: PolicyCenter rating overview
slides.originalNotes:
PolicyCenter rating overview
Costs in PolicyCenter are the •containers" for a monetary amount associated with a policy, e.g., premium, taxes, discounts and surcharges, and other amounts. The task to focus on during implementation is how to capture cost per risk, cost per policy for each line of business (LOB), and total cost per policy. This is how the policy cost I scalculated. Some examples of costs include costs rated by vehicle, costs rated by line and costs such as taxes and surcharges.
slides.notes:
PolicyCenter rating overview
Costs in PolicyCenter are the •containers" for a monetary amount associated with a policy, e.g., premium, taxes, discounts and surcharges, and other amounts. The task to focus on during implementation is how to capture cost per risk, cost per policy for each line of business (LOB), and total cost per policy. This is how the policy cost I scalculated. Some examples of costs include costs rated by vehicle, costs rated by line and costs such as taxes and surcharges.
slides.ocrText:
| PolicyCenter rating overview G

ae

* Rating is the process of determining the cost of a policy

Rating Engine

• Rating output results in information representing the prices for various portions of
the policies such as coverage costs, taxes or fees

slides.title: Knowledge Check
slides.ocrText:
Question
What are some of the actions that take place in terms of rating after a
• quote is requested?
•
SS oe Oooo ee Oooo ooOoD
Gi

questionData.question:
What are some of the actions that take place in terms of rating after a
quote is requested?
questionData.answer:
Possible answers include:
1. Rating Engine selects a Rate Book
2. The Rating Engine calls a Rate Routine for the Cost Item (for example, coverage)
3. The PolicyCenter Rating Engine constructs the corresponding Worksheet with the
calculated results
4. The results are returned to the calling policy transaction (quote)

slides.title: Answer
slides.ocrText:
Answer fa
What are some of the actions that take place in terms of rating after a
oo quote is requested?
“ Possible answers include:
1. Rating Engine selects a Rate Book
2. The Rating Engine calls a Rate Routine for the Cost Item (for example, coverage)
3. The PolicyCenter Rating Engine constructs the corresponding Worksheet with the
calculated results
4. The results are returned to the calling policy transaction (quote)

Demonstration - Personal Auto submission
Sometimes, students take this rating course that have not taken the PolicyCenter Introduction course.

The purpose of this demo is to ensure that all students understand how to work with submissions because they will be doing this later in the course.

This is a modified version of the demos from the PolicyCenter Introduction course, so if the students already understand how to work with submissions, these demos may be skipped.

slides.title: Rate tables and rate table definitions
slides.originalNotes:
Rate tables and rate table definitions
Rate tables provide definitions for a rate factor lookup table. Rate table content is defined within a rate book. Rate tables contain columns representing parameters used to lookup a value, known as a factor. You can use a factor as a rate factor, class, or tier, or as code for use in further lookups. You can view, create, or edit rate tables in PolicyCenter. For example, you can edit rates or add entries for new coverages and limits. For a particular rate table definition, you can specify the parameter combinations and resulting rate factors to assign to that combination.
slides.notes:
Rate tables and rate table definitions
Rate tables provide definitions for a rate factor lookup table. Rate table content is defined within a rate book. Rate tables contain columns representing parameters used to lookup a value, known as a factor. You can use a factor as a rate factor, class, or tier, or as code for use in further lookups. You can view, create, or edit rate tables in PolicyCenter. For example, you can edit rates or add entries for new coverages and limits. For a particular rate table definition, you can specify the parameter combinations and resulting rate factors to assign to that combination.
slides.ocrText:
| Rate tables and rate table definitions i

table format consisting of one or
more rows

* Rate tables contain columns
representing parameters used to
lookup a value, known as a factor.

* Arate table definition describes the
parameters and factors for a
particular rate table

slides.title: Rate routines
slides.originalNotes:
Rate routines
You can use a rate routine:

To calculate properties on cost for coverages, taxes, and other policy costs.

To set up rating information for use by another rate routine.
slides.notes:
Rate routines
You can use a rate routine:

To calculate properties on cost for coverages, taxes, and other policy costs.

To set up rating information for use by another rate routine.
slides.ocrText:
| Rate routines i

« Arate routine defines steps for
calculating a cost for coverage, taxes
and other policy costs

• Arate routine step can specify:
« Mathematical operations
* Logic conditions

« Variable assignments from a rate table
lookup

slides.title: Rate books
slides.originalNotes:
Rate books
A rate book can have an implied rate order or rate steps; rate flow can be included in the rate book.
slides.notes:
Rate books
A rate book can have an implied rate order or rate steps; rate flow can be included in the rate book.
slides.ocrText:
| Rate books i

• Arate book is a group of rate tables
and rate routines

* Rate books can be accessed from
the Administration tab > Rating >
Rate Books

slides.title: Rating engine and rate flow fa
slides.originalNotes:
Rating engine and rate flow
Rate flow is the logic used in the rating engine. It orchestrates the premium calculation for a policy line and coordinates actions among the various rating components.

For more technical audiences:

Rate flows are a subset of the rating plugin.
The rateS!ice method is the container for the flow. An example is provided in the base configuration for commercial property and personal auto policies.

Some implementations require a different rate flow strategy than what is provided in the base configuration For example, an implementation may need to rate multi-line policies as a single component. To implement this, override the rateOnly method in the AbstractRatjngEngid2.e class to express the needed logic. Another alternative rate flow is to include the rate flow in a table rather than hard-coding the rate routines. Hard-coding rate routines is not recommended.
slides.notes:
Rating engine and rate flow

For more technical audiences:

To implement this, override the rateOnly method in the AbstractRatjngEngid2.e class to express the needed logic. Another alternative rate flow is to include the rate flow in a table rather than hard-coding the rate routines. Hard-coding rate routines is not recommended.
slides.ocrText:
| Rating engine and rate flow fa

• The base implementation of the
rating engine uses a hierarchy of
classes and flexible logic

* The term “rate flow” refers to the
logic in the rating engine that
calculates the premium

Rate Flow

slides.title: Process for implementing rating
slides.ocrText:
| Process for implementing rating

Rating Analyst © What is the process for
implementing rating?

While the rating manual
remains the same, you have
to adjust the content so that
it works in PolicyCenter.

Julia
Implementation We
Architect

!

slides.title: Move rating content to PolicyCenter
slides.originalNotes:
Move rating content to PolicyCenter
By moving to PolicyCenter, you are implementing a Policy Administration System. Your existing rating content is probably not ready for the system. While the rating manual stays the same, you must focus early efforts on adjusting the rating content format so that it works in the PolicyCenter.
slides.notes:
Move rating content to PolicyCenter
By moving to PolicyCenter, you are implementing a Policy Administration System. Your existing rating content is probably not ready for the system. While the rating manual stays the same, you must focus early efforts on adjusting the rating content format so that it works in the PolicyCenter.
slides.ocrText:
| Move rating content to PolicyCenter Gi

Mainframe Policy Administration System

;) rating manual

The rating manual is the same, but the format is changed

slides.title: The actuary’s (or rating analyst's) role
slides.originalNotes:
The actuary's (or rating analyst's) role
Before you can rate using PolicyCenter, you (actuaries and rating specialists) need to examine the rating content and the format so that it makes sense to PolicyCenter. The rating manual will remain the same.

Start at the coverage level, then look at the various aspects that influence the rating.
slides.notes:
The actuary's (or rating analyst's) role
Before you can rate using PolicyCenter, you (actuaries and rating specialists) need to examine the rating content and the format so that it makes sense to PolicyCenter. The rating manual will remain the same.

Start at the coverage level, then look at the various aspects that influence the rating.
slides.ocrText:
| The actuary’s (or rating analyst's) role G

&

• During implementation, actuaries
provide rating-specific content to
configuration developers

• The format you have may not work

• Work with implementation experts to
transition“old” rating content format to
a PolicyCenter-ready format while
keeping the rating manual the same

and rate routines together for

jurisdiction.

slides.title: Review: What is required?
slides.originalNotes:
Review: What is required?
The goal of the rating content •translation" is to arrive at the following components: Costs, Rate Flow, Rate Routines* , Rate Tables*

The existing rating 'state’ determines the work required to transform' rating content. Rating content may already exist, but its exact state varies. Any of the following could be true:

1) The rates are available in a spreadsheet for calculation, or the rates can be automatically rated using a predetermined formula

2) A spreadsheet model is available for rate calculation

3) The rating content exists in a PDF or manual

REVIEW: Rate flow is the rating engine logic- It orchestrates the premium calculation for a policy line.

For a more technical audience:

Rate flows are a subset of the Rating plugin and the rateSlice method is the container for the flow. An example is provided in the base configuration for commercial property (CP) and personal auto (PA) policies. Some implementations require different rate flow strategies than what is provided in base configuration. For example, an implementation may need to rate multi-line policies as a single component. To implement this, override the rateOnly method in the AÅ±actRatngEnguze class to express the needed logic.

Rate Routines and Rate Tables are of particular interest to actuaries because this is the most familiar data- Rate books are a group of rate tables and rate routines; the rate flow logic selects the rate book that will be used to access rate tables and rate routines.
slides.notes:

premium calculation

in a lookup format

Rate Routines: Algorithms used to
calculate premium

slides.title: Rate flow implementation approach fa
slides.originalNotes:
Rate flow implementation approach
Rate Flow defines the order of execution.

System table rating engines have rate routines hard coded as a sample or demo of rating capabilities.

Simple rate LOBs may not require much beyond the PA OOTB PA Rating Engine.

Recommended practice is not to hard code rate routines.

See the WC Basic Template or the Rate Flow Order Accelerator for samples.
slides.notes:
Rate flow implementation approach
Rate Flow defines the order of execution.

System table rating engines have rate routines hard coded as a sample or demo of rating capabilities.

Simple rate LOBs may not require much beyond the PA OOTB PA Rating Engine.

Recommended practice is not to hard code rate routines.

See the WC Basic Template or the Rate Flow Order Accelerator for samples.
slides.ocrText:
| Rate flow implementation approach fa

• The rate flow defines the order of
execution

• Simple rate lines of business (LOB) may
not require much alteration from out-of-
the-box (OOTB) samples*

• Analternative approach to hard-coding
the rate routines is to define the rate
order in a table of its own which will call
the routines according to priority

Q

+ Examples exist for PARatingEngine.gs and
CPRatingEngine.gs in the base configuration
of PolicyCenter

* Hard-coding rate routines is NOT
recommended

What is the process that an actuary or rating analyst must follow in order
to prepare usable rating content for the configuration developer?
questionData.answer:
Each rating implementation starts from a different place. For example, a rating analyst
may have a spreadsheet with existing rating data or it may be contained in the current
system in another format. Actuaries and rating specialists must create content that is
PolicyCenter ready.
